titlestmt.titleproper: Register of the Robert Parvin Williams papers
titlestmt.author: Finding aid prepared by Aparna Mukherjee

profiledesc.creation: This finding aid was produced using the Archivists' Toolkit 2016-02-17T16:29-0800

change.item: Declassified records series added to collection by Sarah Patton.

did.abstract: The papers of Robert Parvin Williams, Brigadier General, U.S. Army, include diaries, memoirs, correspondence, studies, memoranda, photographs, maps, charts, and printed matter relating to the U.S. Army Medical Service in the China-India-Burma Theater during World War II and during the Korean War.

accessrestrict.head: Access
accessrestrict.p: The collection is open for research

The Hoover Institution Archives only allows access to copies of audiovisual items. To listen to sound recordings or to view videos or films during your visit, please contact the Archives at least two working days before your arrival. We will then advise you of the accessibility of the material you wish to see or hear. Please note that not all audiovisual material is immediately accessible.

userestrict.head: Publication Rights
userestrict.p: For copyright status, please contact the Hoover Institution Archives.

prefercite.head: Preferred Citation
prefercite.p: [Identification of item], Robert Parvin Williams papers, [Box no.], Hoover Institution Archives

acqinfo.head: Acquisition Information
acqinfo.p: Materials were acquired by the Hoover Institution Archives in 1968.

accruals.head: Accruals
accruals.p: Materials may have been added to the collection since this finding aid was prepared. To determine if this has occurred, find the collection in Stanford University's online catalog at http://searchworks.stanford.edu/. Materials have been added to the collection if the number of boxes listed in the online catalog is larger than the number of boxes listed in this finding aid.

chronitem.event: Born, Greencastle, Indiana
Intern, Ancon Hospital, Panama Canal Zone
M.D., University of Cincinnati
Cincinnati General Hospital
First Lieutenant, Medical Corps, U.S. Army
Student, Army Medical School
Adjutant, Camp Hospital, Mexican border, Douglas, Arizona
Assistant Divisional Surgeon
Organizer and Commander, General Hospital No. 34, East Norfolk, Massachusetts
Honor graduate, Medical Field Service School
Student, Command and General Staff School
Army War College
Chemical Warfare School
Instructor, Infantry School, Fort Benning, Georgia
Director, training, Medical Field Service School, Carlisle Barracks, Pennsylvania
Commanding officer, First Regiment, march from Pennsylvania to California
Member, General Joseph Stilwell's military mission to China and Burma
Surgeon, General Stilwell's column, retreat from Burma to India
Chief surgeon, General Dan I. Sultan, India-Burma theater
Army surgeon, Fourth Army
Special assistant to surgeon general
Promoted through grades to Brigadier General
Died

scopecontent.head: Scope and Content of Collection
scopecontent.p: The papers of Robert Parvin Williams, Brigadier General, U.S. Army, include diaries, memoirs, correspondence, studies, memoranda, photographs, maps, charts, and printed matter relating to the U.S. Army Medical Service in the China-India-Burma Theater during World War II and during the Korean War.

The Biographical File, in addition to Williams' curriculum vitae and citations, offers an example of his skills as a writer and a speaker. But of more interest to the researchers might be his diaries, divided in sections in chronological order, recording announcements of citations, daily events and schedules, his itineraries, and descriptions of performance of his duties in the context of the prevalent military situation of 1941 to 1945.

The bulk of the materials in the collection relate to the services provided by the medical units of different army divisions within the framework of the United States Army operations in various parts of the world. All of these documents are included in the United States Army File. The materials are listed in chronological order under the names of the army units with a description of physical forms. Williams' work in the China-Burma-India theater along with General Joseph Stilwell deserves a particular mention.

The series of Photographs is a visual record of army operations involving machinery, weapons, and individuals. Some photographic prints are attached to the materials they illustrate, and they have been left in the United States Army File where noted. Loose prints, including oversize prints, are generally listed in chronological order with information about dates and the names of photographers whenever available. Loose prints found in the folders have been left in place, as they might be better understood if considered in the context of the materials in the folder.

relatedmaterial.head: Related Material
relatedmaterial.p: Joseph W. Stilwell papers, Hoover Institution Archives
Frank Dorn papers, Hoover Institution Archives
Raymond A. Wheeler papers, Hoover Institution Archives

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Includes a curriculum vitae, citations, diary, index to Williams' personal correspondence, and writings and speeches by him and by others, arranged alphabetically by physical form.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Relates to Army War College instruction, the role of medical service units in the context of the United States Army operations in general, performance of various army units and training facilities, and the conduct of the war based on situations in different geographical areas.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: 277 photographic prints, including 2 oversize prints of Army officials and 27 negatives, reflecting army operations with machinery and individuals.

did.unittitle: 2 oversize group photographic prints of army officials,
43 prints, Cavalry Division, and 5 prints depicting army vehicles,
18 prints depicting army operations, modes of transport, and personnel,
4 prints and 2 negatives taken by Johnny McKee depicting D-Day on the Florida Gulf coast objective area,
26 prints depicting the sea, ships with numbers, military vehicles, land transports, and soldiers (including wounded ones),
12 prints depicting soldiers with horses in open fields or by a mountain, Fort Bliss, Texas,
1 print depicting 4 soldiers (their names are on the other side of the print) standing in front of a building,
5 prints (taken by Don Thompson?) depicting soldiers with horses engaged in various activities,
86 prints, including some from Cavalry Division, depicting soldiers involved in various activities,
12 prints depicting soldiers playing and a building, Army War College,
2 prints of a number of people (with their names listed) belonging to different medical groups, Fourth Corps,

29 prints depicting China-Burma-India sector, including the retreat from Burma to India with a note from Joseph Stilwell about Robert Williams' contribution and award of the Purple Heart to Joseph Stilwell,

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Includes description of the prints on the other side.

did.unittitle: 6 prints taken by John McKee depicting soldiers of the Second Armored Division,
25 negatives and 2 miniature films returned by the Fourth Army with a request for developing for the purpose of using them in an article,
1 print depicting a soldier receiving medical care during the Korean conflict,

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Formerly security-classified records of the U.S. government, released in full or in part. Arranged chronologically by date of release by Hoover, thereunder chronologically by date of creation.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: [China-Burma-India] Theater Map indicating sectional boundaries and their dates of establishment. Produced by the Office of the Chief Engineer, U.S. Air Force.
